Package cz.cvut.fel.omo.smarthome.model.abstractEntities

Class Appliance

java.lang.Object
cz.cvut.fel.omo.smarthome.model.abstractEntities.HouseholdItem
cz.cvut.fel.omo.smarthome.model.abstractEntities.Appliance
All Implemented Interfaces:
PowerConsumption, Observer, ApplianceInterface, Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlarmSystem, Blinds, CoffeeMachine, Door, Fridge, HeatingSystem, LightingSystem, PetFeeder, Ventilation, WateringSystem
public abstract class Appliance extends HouseholdItem implements ApplianceInterface, PowerConsumption, Observer
Represents an abstract electrical appliance in the smart home. Contains core logic for power consumption strategies and state management. This is a key class implementing several design patterns: State, Strategy, Proxy, Observer, and Visitor.

    Field
    Description
    protected final List<Event>
    handledEvents
    A list of events that have already been handled by this appliance.

    powerConsumption
    The base power consumption of the appliance (kW/tick).
    protected Queue<Event>
    todoList
    A queue of pending events that the appliance couldn't process immediately (Priority Queue).

  • Method Details

    • accept

      public void accept(ConsumptionVisitorInterface visitor)
      Implements the Visitor pattern: accepts the consumption visitor. This method specifically delegates to the visitor's visit(Appliance) method.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface Element
      Overrides:
      accept in class HouseholdItem
      Parameters:
      visitor - The consumption visitor interface.

    • update

      public void update(Event event)
      Receives an event (implementation of the Observer pattern). If the appliance is currently busy (was used this tick), the event is added to the todoList. Otherwise, it is processed immediately.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      event - The received event.

    • updateSimulationTick

      public void updateSimulationTick()
      Logic executed in every simulation step (tick). This handles: 1. Continuous energy consumption and lifetime decrease if the appliance is ON. 2. Processing a pending event from the todoList if the appliance becomes free.

    • completeCurrentAction

      public void completeCurrentAction()
      Marks the current action as complete. This acts as a hook for concrete subclasses to wrap up operations.

    • processEvent

      protected abstract void processEvent(Event event)
      Abstract method for processing a specific event type. The concrete implementation depends on the specific appliance type.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to process.

    • getPowerConsumption

      public double getPowerConsumption()
      Calculates the current power consumption based on the active strategy (Strategy pattern).
      Specified by:
      getPowerConsumption in interface PowerConsumption
      Returns:
      The power consumption value (kW/tick).

    • updatePowerUsageAndLifetime

      public void updatePowerUsageAndLifetime()
      Updates the total energy consumed and decreases the usage lifetime. If totalEnergyConsumed exceeds the POWER_SAVING_THRESHOLD, the consumption strategy is switched to PowerSavingStrategy.
      Specified by:
      updatePowerUsageAndLifetime in interface ApplianceInterface

    • turnOn

      public void turnOn()
      Turns the appliance on. State transition is delegated to the current state object (State pattern).
      Specified by:
      turnOn in interface ApplianceInterface

    • turnOff

      public void turnOff()
      Turns the appliance off. State transition is delegated to the current state object (State pattern).
      Specified by:
      turnOff in interface ApplianceInterface

    • use

      public void use()
      Uses the appliance. If the appliance is currently off, it automatically turns on. The action is delegated to the current state object (State pattern).
      Specified by:
      use in interface ApplianceInterface

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repairs the appliance. The action is delegated to the current state object (State pattern).
      Specified by:
      repair in interface ApplianceInterface
      Overrides:
      repair in class HouseholdItem

    • decreaseUsageLifetime

      public void decreaseUsageLifetime()
      Decreases the remaining usage lifetime by one unit.

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Checks if the appliance is available for use (i.e., it is Off or On).
      Specified by:
      isAvailable in interface ApplianceInterface
      Returns:
      true if available, false otherwise.

    • isBroken

      public boolean isBroken()
      Checks if the appliance is broken.
      Returns:
      true if broken (ApplianceBrokenState), false otherwise.

    • isOff

      public boolean isOff()
      Checks if the appliance is off.
      Returns:
      true if off (ApplianceOffState), false otherwise.

    • performInstantAction

      protected boolean performInstantAction()
      Performs an instant action using a Proxy object (Proxy pattern). This is useful for direct method calls, ensuring auto-on if the appliance is off, but preventing action if the appliance is already busy this tick.
      Returns:
      true if the action was successfully performed, false if busy.

    • turnOnState

      protected boolean turnOnState()
      Helper method to transition to the On state.
      Returns:
      true if the state is now ApplianceOnState.

    • turnOffState

      protected boolean turnOffState()
      Helper method to transition to the Off state.
      Returns:
      true if the state is now ApplianceOffState.

    • setUsedThisTick

      public void setUsedThisTick(boolean wasUsedThisTick)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the appliance was used in the current tick.
      Specified by:
      setUsedThisTick in interface ApplianceInterface
      Parameters:
      wasUsedThisTick - The new state of the usage flag.

    • resetWasUsedThisTick

      public void resetWasUsedThisTick()
      Resets the usage flag at the beginning of a new simulation tick.
